data.comment: Label for Embroidery Size panel

data.name: Convert_LabelNbColors
data.comment: Label for the number of color in KMeans process

data.name: Convert_LabelNbIteration
data.comment: Label for the number of iteration of KMeans process

data.name: ConvertLabelModel
data.comment: Label for the model of color used

data.name: Tutorial_Title1Text
data.comment: Welcome message in tutorial page

data.name: Tutorial_Part1Text
data.value: This application aims to offer to embroiderers, to generate an embroidery pattern from an image, then to export it in PDF.
data.comment: Aim of the app message in tutoral page

data.name: Tutorial_Part2Text
data.value: For this, BrodUI uses the K-Means algorithm. This one allows to reduce efficiently the number of colors of your image to avoid having hundreds of different thread colors.
data.comment: K-Means message in tutorial page

data.name: Tutorial_Title2Text
data.comment: HTU message in tutorial page

data.name: Tutorial_Part3aText
data.comment: Part a of the 3rd text in tutorial page

data.name: Tutorial_Part3cText
data.value: in the sidebar. You will then be able to choose your image, its dimensions, the number of thread colors you want and the number of iterations of the algorithm (the more iterations, the longer the process takes, but the more accurate it is). Then finally you can convert your image.
data.comment: Part c of the 3rd text in tutorial page

data.name: Tutorial_Part4aText
data.value: The export page is now in front of you. You can see the transformed image, the list of threads and their quantities and the associated embroidery pattern. With a simple click on the
data.comment: Part a of the 4th text in tutorial page

data.name: Tutorial_Part4cText
data.value: button, you will be able to obtain a PDF file with your embroidery pattern.
data.comment: Part c of the 4th text in tutorial page

data.name: Tutorial_Part5aText
data.value: If the size of your pattern is too small, then you can change in the
data.comment: Part a of the 5th text in tutorial page

data.name: Tutorial_Part5cText
data.value: If the size of your pattern is too small, then you can change in the "Settings", the size of an embroidery stitch. In this page you can also change the language and theme of the application, get additional information using the terminal or visit the GitHub page of the project.
data.comment: Part c of the 5th text in tutorial page

data.name: Tutorial_BeginButtonLabel
data.comment: Label of the button to begin usage of BrodUI

data.name: Convert_ToolTipLoadImage
data.value: Load an image from your PC to convert it
data.comment: ToolTip of Load Image button

data.value: Change the width of the loaded image
data.comment: ToolTip of image Width

data.name: Convert_ToolTipImageHeight
data.value: Change the height of the loaded image
data.comment: ToolTip of image Height

data.name: Convert_ToolTipNbColor
data.value: Choose the number of colors of the converted image
data.comment: ToolTip of number of Color for K-Means Algorithm

data.name: Convert_ToolTipNbIterations
data.value: Choose the number of iterations of the algorithm (the higher the value, the longer but more accurate)
data.comment: ToolTip of number of Iterations for K-Means Algorithm

data.name: Convert_ToolTipModel
data.value: Choose the color scheme (results may differ)
data.comment: ToolTip of color Model for K-Means Algorithm

data.name: Convert_ToolTipConvertButton
data.comment: ToolTip of Convert button

data.name: Export_ToolTipConvertButton
data.value: Convert the pattern to PDF (the name of the document will be the name of the pattern)
data.comment: ToolTip of Convert button

data.name: Terminal_InTime
data.comment: "In" word displayed in terminal before time

data.name: Convert_BigEmbroideryWarning
data.value: Converting to a big embroidery size can take a lot of time, are you sure you want to continue ?
data.comment: Warning shown when width * height is big

data.name: Terminal_Cancel
data.comment: Used for "Cancel" buttons
